definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond

sentences.english: But now it seems Indians, too, are getting less worked up about dalliances.
sentences.chinese: 如今似乎印度人也對放蕩不那麼激動了。

sentences.english: He was handsome in a raffish kind of way.
sentences.chinese: 他的帥是一種放蕩不羈的帥。

sentences.english: He plays the novel's rakish hero.
sentences.chinese: 他扮演小說中放蕩的主人公。

sentences.english: The Fundies believe that these wanton women know too much about sex.
sentences.chinese: 專家相信放蕩的女人對性更瞭解。

sentences.english: Extravagance and vanity had made him coldhearted and selfish.
sentences.chinese: 放蕩和虛榮使他變得殘忍自私。

sentences.english: So being rakish is a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 所以行爲放蕩還是一件好事。

sentences.english: Debauchery of the tail of defects.
A suave charmer, he had a reputation for living fast.
sentences.chinese: 他本人魅力十足，生活放蕩不羈。

sentences.english: And be not drunk with wine, wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;
sentences.chinese: 不要醉酒，酒能使人放蕩，乃要被聖靈充滿。

sentences.english: I have been wild and foolish.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經放蕩不羈，愚不可及。

sentences.english: After Andhra accompanied by, debauchery see this calendar.
sentences.chinese: 安得陪後乘，放蕩此歷睹。

sentences.english: Helen is a bimbo, for she is always flirting with me.
sentences.chinese: 海倫是一個放蕩的女人，因爲她總是挑逗我。

sentences.english: He was drinking cheap champagne with a raffish air.
sentences.chinese: 他喝着廉價的香檳酒，樣子十分放蕩。

sentences.english: "Majesty, " debauch Chinese answers, "A pieceoftableisdiffered only between them.
sentences.chinese: “陛下，”放蕩漢答道，“它們之間僅差一張桌子。”

sentences.english: I'm afraid your fickle dissolute mood is not stable.
sentences.chinese: 我怕自己善變放蕩的情緒不太安定。

sentences.english: Jie was extremely tyrannical and dissolute.
sentences.chinese: 桀是個極端殘暴，放蕩的人。

definition: (of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to put on an act (idiom); to show affectation/to indulge in histrionics
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful/also written 傾城傾國|倾城倾国[qing1 cheng2 qing1 guo2]
see 直截了當|直截了当[zhi2 jie2 liao3 dang4]
to show off/to try to be brave
